h1.style: font-size: 2em; color: #000000; font-family: sans-serif; background-color: #ffd800; text-align: center;

span.style: text-decoration-line: underline; font-size: 48px;

h2.style: color: #000000; font-family: sans-serif; background-color: #ffd800; text-align: center;

p.style: color: #000000; font-family: sans-serif; background-color: #ffd800; text-align: center;

span.style: font-size: 32px;
font-size: 14pt;
font-size: 14pt;
font-size: 10pt;

p.span: Adopted Monday, April 20, 2020 by HISD School Board

span.style: font-size: 12pt;
font-size: 12pt;

li.span: Fourth six weeks numeric average will be copied for the fifth and sixth six weeks.

span.style: font-size: 12pt;

li.span: The fifth six week grading period will be extended to Friday, May 15th. The sixth six week grading period will end on Friday, May 22, 2020.

span.style: font-size: 12pt;

li.span: Valedictorian and Salutatorian for the 8th grade and senior class will be determined through the fourth six weeks.

span.style: font-size: 12pt;

li.span: Students who failed the fourth six weeks will be given alternative assignments the week of May 11th - 15th to provide an opportunity to raise the grade to a passing average.

span.style: font-size: 12pt;

li.span: There will be no semester finals for the second semester.

span.style: font-size: 12pt;

li.span: All students MUST submit 70% of assignments assigned to receive pass/fail credit for the class and grade promotion.

span.style: font-size: 12pt;

li.span: Seniors MUST receive credit for all classes in order to graduate.

span.style: font-size: 12pt;

li.span: Grades posted in gradebook from March 16, 2020 through May 15, 2020 will be reflective of assignments completed not numeric grades. Completed assignments will be entered as 100 and missing assignments will be entered as an M.

span.style: font-size: 12pt;

li.span: Progress Notices will be sent home weekly to parents whose student assignment completion is below 70%.

span.style: font-size: 12pt;

li.span: Dual Credit classes will count as numeric grades for the semester with WTC per their agreement.

span.style: font-size: 12pt;

li.span: Paper assignments can be provided to those students who have internet/submission issues preventing their assignment completion.

span.style: font-size: 10pt;

em.span: This policy reflects the TEA requirements of the district’s accountability and documentation of student remote learning during the school closure.

div.div: Our 8th Grade Graduation will be virtual this year. Your sponsors will be contacting you with more information about what, exactly, this will look like as this develops. We will also update this tab with new information as it is made available. Thank you for your patience, understanding and support during this time as we work to make this event special for everyone.
Due to the restrictive guidelines currently in place, the Highland Board has chosen to cancel Baccalaureate for the 2020 school year. Thank you for your understanding where this event is concerned.

The HISD Board made a motion to postpone any decision regarding graduation until the May Board meeting. They understand the importance of this milestone for the students and families, and want to give it all the attention that it is deserving of. Sponsors and administration will be in contact with families as this progresses.

The Highland Board has decided it is in the best interest of all parties involved to cancel the 2020 Senior Trip. A motion was made a carried in a unanimous vote to distribute the funds equally between all of the seniors who were already scheduled to participate in the event. Sponsors will be in contact with students and parents when funds will be made available.

margin-top: 6px; margin-bottom: 0px; display: inline; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff;

div.p: Today, April 17th, Governor Abbott closed all Texas schools for the remainder of the school year. We will be getting more guidance from our school Board Monday night on how we proceed from here with things such as grading policies and graduations. We will update our website with this information as it becomes available. If you have any questions please email your teachers, principal or superintendent. Thank you for your patience and understanding as we work through this unprecedented time.

Governor Greg Abbott has issued an executive order directing all schools in Texas to remain closed through April 3rd. We will continue to provide instruction via online learning platforms as we have outlined before. We will let you know if anything changes before April 3rd. We wish you the best and hope you all stay safe and healthy.

p.span: Pre-K and Kindergarten students will have instructional packets with two weeks worth of lessons. These packets will include traditional paper/pencil work as well as materials available online.

span.style: font-size: 12px;

font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 12px; font-family: Arial;
font-size: 12px;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 12px; font-family: Arial;

p.span: First through fifth grade students will use Chromebooks. Instruction will be delivered through Seesaw. Teachers will communicate assignments given on Monday and due by Sunday night (midnight).

span.style: font-size: 12px;

font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 12px; font-family: Arial;
font-size: 12px;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 12px; font-family: Arial;

p.span: Sixth through twelfth grade students will use Chromebooks. Instruction will be delivered through Google Classroom. Teachers will communicate and assign work on Monday and will be due by Friday of the same week. It is imperative that these students check their email daily.

span.style: font-size: 12px;

font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 12px; font-family: Arial;
font-size: 12px;
font-size: 12px;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 12px; font-family: Arial;

span.span: Our teachers will be available to provide assistance to our students. Email will be our best form of communication since our teachers will also be off campus. If you have technical issues with the devices please email Brooke Sanford

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial;

span.span: . There will also be a webpage on the school website to help assist parents with online learning.

span.style: font-size: 12px;

font-size: 12px;
font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 12px; font-family: Arial;

p.span: Special Education and 504 Services will be provided. The district will contact parents if additional accommodations need to be made.

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 12px; font-family: Arial;

p.style: color: #414141; font-family: open_sansregular, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; background-color: #ffffff;
color: #414141; font-family: open_sansregular, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; background-color: #ffffff;

div.p:
Given the rapidly evolving situation with COVID-19, Highland ISD will extend the suspension of normal district operations through March 27, 2020 in an effort to support our nation's need to slow the spread in the state. An increase in confirmed cases closer to our area has increased the probability of it coming closer to our community. To help you prepare, we are coordinating with other school districts in our region as well as health officials to determine if there is a need to extend the closure further.
All staff members will need to report as usual to help prepare for this change in instruction. Again, thank you for understanding during this time of uncertainty.

p.style: color: #414141; font-family: open_sansregular, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; background-color: #ffffff;

div.style: margin: 0px; color: #414141; font-family: open_sansregular, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; background-color: #ffffff;

span.style: font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: #ffffff; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1d2129;
font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: #ffffff; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1d2129;

p.span: Highland ISD will reopen Wednesday, March 18. We ask that you complete a short survey posted on our website before your child returns to school. If you are unable to complete the online survey, please call the school and complete via phone before your child returns to school. If your child is medically fragile, displaying symptoms associated with COVID-19, or you are otherwise uncomfortable with sending them to school at this time, you are welcome to keep them at home with an excused absence. Teachers are training today to deliver online instruction for students that are not here. Things are changing on a daily basis and we will keep you informed if anything changes.

span.style: font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: #ffffff; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1d2129;

div.div:
Highland Independent School District
6625 FM 608, Roscoe, Texas 79545
Phone: (325) 766-3652 | Fax: (325) 766-2281
